project.name: { joopl };
project.description: Object-oriented programming for JavaScript on the Web and anywhere!

$namespace.name: $namespace
$namespace.description:
The `$namespace` keyword represents an static object holding methods/functions to manage namespaces. ### What is a namespace?

A namespace is an identifier holding zero or more members like classes.

In object-oriented programming namespaces are a key and strong feature, since it prevents name collisions: for example, two or more classes can live into the same code library, but since each one belongs to a different namespace, this can happen with no issues:

MyNamespace.Class1 MyNamespace.MyOtherNamespace.Class1 MyNamespace.AnotherNamespace.Class1 YetAnotherNamespace.Class1

Namespaces must be defined using the $namespace.register method.

Once some code requires to use these classes, it can access the right class by using the full namespace path:

var instance = new $global.MyNamespace.Class1(); var instance2 = new $global.$MyNamespace.MyOtherNamespace.Class1(); var instance3 = new $global.$MyNamespace.AnotherNamespace.Class1(); var instance4 = new $global.YetAnotherNamespace.Class1();

This is very useful in order to let different JavaScript libraries define classes with exactly the same name but doing absolutely different things. Namespaces isolate each one.

The $global namespace

jOOPL has a top-most namespace called `$global`. Any namespace registered using the whole `$namespace.register(...)` method will be nested into the `$global` namespace.

As JavaScript top-most object is the `Window` object and any variable or function defined in the global scope belongs to `Window`, this can lead to bad practices, because more than a JavaScript library may define the same variable names, functions and other constructs. jOOPL isolates any member defined by itself in the `$global` namespace in order to prevent issues with other libraries.

$def.name: $def

Type.name: Type
Type.description: Represents type information and provides access to types' metadata.

Attribute.name: Attribute

EnumValue.name: EnumValue
EnumValue.description:
Represents an enumeration value and provides access to common operations for the whole enumeration value.

See {{#crossLink "$enumdef"}}{{/crossLink}} to learn more about enumerations.

Enum.name: Enum
Enum.description: Represents an utility class to work with enumerations.

$enumdef.name: $enumdef

classitems.name: register

params.name: path
params.description: A namespace path. For example, "joopl.sample" will register "joopl" and its child "sample".

params.name: copedFunc
params.description: A parameterless function representing the scope where the `this` keyword is the childest registered namespace (for example, registering "joopl.sample', the `this` keyword will be the *sample* namespace).

classitems.name: using

params.name: paths
params.description: An array of strings of the namespaces to import

params.name: scopedFunc
params.description: A function to create a namespace scope (optional)

params.name: scopeIsNs
params.description: USED BY THE SYSTEM. IT IS NOT RECOMMENDED FOR DEVELOPERS. A boolean flag specifying if the this keyword in the scoped function must be the childest namespace or not (optional)

classitems.description: Gets an attribute instance by giving its type, if the type has the whole attribute
classitems.name: getAttribute

return.description: The attribute instance or `null` if the type does not have the given attribute type

classitems.description: Performs a bitwise OR with the given enumeration value
classitems.name: or

return.description: The flag of two or more enumeration values

example: var flag = State.open.enum.or(State.closed); // This is State.open | State.closed

classitems.description: Performs a bitwise AND with the given enumeration value
classitems.name: and

return.description: The flag of two or more enumeration values

example: var flag = State.open.enum.and(State.closed); // This is State.open & State.closed

classitems.description: Determines if some enumeration value contains other enumeration value.
classitems.name: hasFlag

return.description: A boolean specifying if the given enumeration value was found in the flag.

example:
var flag = State.open.enum.or(State.closed);
    var hasOpen = flag.enum.hasFlag(State.open);

classitems.name: parseName

params.name: valueName
params.description: The value name to be parsed (i.e. If an enumeration called States would have an *open* and *closed* values, *open* or *closed* would be a value names)
